storyInfo: Kal'tsit finally rendezvouses with Elysium, and meets the members of AUS. At the same time, the death of the Sea Terror has mobilized its deformed kin, causing the entire town to descend into terror.

attributes.content: The sea is black.
I was four or five at the time. Old Thiago, the mayor of Gran Faro, took an armed company of adults down to the coast.

I still remember what the weather was like back then. It was hazy and turbulent, and colder than most evenings despite still being afternoon. Its coldness was not a temperature, but rather a color. One that had lost its warmth.
I found out only later that that was the last time Gran Faro did maintenance work on the Eye of Iberia. Or rather, tried to.

The Penal Battalion quickly brought back news. There was dejection in the adults' faces, but I didn't fully understand what had happened. I simply stared at the junction between sea and sky in a daze.
The sea is black.
It perfectly suits this land devoid of hope.
Mayor Thiago is here!
attributes.name: Crowd of Onlookers

attributes.content: So what old Pedri said was true, Amaia.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Even if I wished to deny it, I'd be quickly silenced by the reality in front of our eyes.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: But, what kind of person could slay a monster, then off-handedly toss it here?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I hope you'll let me handle this.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: That...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: If we don't dispose of it properly, I'm afraid it could become a danger down the road. Besides, is this not a rare opportunity to study a Sea Terror?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: ...Very well. But I'll be coming with you.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: None of us know exactly what this thing is just yet, and we certainly can't rule out the possibility that its blood might attract more of its kind.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: No objections here.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: With me, lads. Move aside, so I can wrap up this body—
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: ...Well, it's not as heavy as it looks. So where to, Amaia?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Follow me.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Don't just stand there gaping. Hurry on home now, people.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Are we really not going to report this to the Inquisition? What do we do if more monsters show up?
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: There's no need to get them involved.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: I said, we don't need 'em!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: Thiago.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: This town doesn't need the Penal Battalion interfering just yet. We'll handle things our own way.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: If the Inquisition sent its people here and saw this thing, you'd never see another peaceful day in Gran Faro. Do you really not understand that?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: But— Never mind, forget it.
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: Let's go, Amaia.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: We're really just going to listen to him?
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: Old Thiago's hatred for the Inquisition goes back more than a day or two, but if something really were to happen without the Penal Battalion here, who's gonna fight the monsters? Us?
attributes.name: Nihilistic Townsperson

attributes.content: Plus, there've been more and more outsiders lately. It's like Thiago doesn't even see them. If they were to blend in with the outsiders...
attributes.name: Nihilistic Townsperson

attributes.content: I knew it, we really should send someone to the Inquisition! How are we supposed to explain all this if someone from the Penal Battalion does show up? I don't want to get branded a heretic!
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: Miss Amaia... and what's with that author over there...?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Let's touch base with the other members of AUS first. I feel like we can't just ignore all this.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Is the chapel normally this deserted? What happened to your God and your faith?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Not every Iberian is a practicing Lateran. Miss Alty, the town has become quite dangerous, and I need to ensure your safety until Dr. Kal'tsit arrives.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Might as well put on a show here then. Some music would help calm everyone's nerves.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Haha, that's not what I meant.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Then calm down. Let me take a stab at what I think happened.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Hmm... I saw... some kind of sea creature. Right, you guys called it a Sea Terror. Whether the Iberians or Kal'tsit were first to call it that doesn't really matter to me.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: A Sea Terror beneath a cruelly dry sky, its observant and analytical scales with nowhere to belong. It knows very well that this is not its home. It lives, back home.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: I've got it! That Sea Terror was probably hung high up on that sculpture, and it was singing the latest wave of rock-'n'-roll. Right?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: ...It wasn't hung up there. Nor was it singing. But you got like eighty or ninety percent of it down.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: You've surprised me again, Miss Alty. Was that your Arts?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Who's to say that death itself isn't just another kind of song? That's what it taught me. And it's a real travesty of nature that the beauty of it can't be appreciated across species.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: What do you think?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Fortunately, such an artform is not required by all organisms.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: D-Dr. Kal'tsit! How come I couldn't get a hold of you this whole time...?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Long story short, I'm under the surveillance of the Iberian Inquisition in exchange for their trust.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We don't have much time, but the task before us is grave. Operator Elysium, go keep an eye on the two who took the Sea Terror's body away. I need to speak with Alty alone.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Understood.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Here's a communicator. You should already be familiar with my Originium Arts, so you can also, uh, pass it on to your colleagues.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Will do.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I know you prefer to keep handovers quick and efficient, but let me say this: I'm so relieved that you're safe and sound.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: If I discover anything, I'll report back right away. Heading out.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Mm. Appreciate it.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Long time no see, Doctor.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Miss Alty.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Sorry for making you come all this way. I understand this involves putting yourselves at risk to some extent.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So why are you under surveillance? You couldn't just cut a deal with them?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Time is short, and Iberia's paranoia masquerading as piety prevents me from meeting with the Inquisition's upper echelons.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Hmm... Are you in a hurry?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: The other countries still do not understand what we are dealing with. They are unable to comprehend how a vast, mighty land in its Golden Age disappeared into the Silence.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And I... may as well have witnessed it with my own eyes.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Fair enough.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Where are the others?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We rarely get to go on a tour, so let them enjoy some free time. What you want is right here.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: I came to you for the same reason as last time.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: That said, I have little love for the sea these days. Especially after hearing what you had to say about it.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Hopefully you've had enough time to make up your mind.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Before we get to that, Doctor... Doesn't it seem like you've been working on... let's call it your bedside manner?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Like, uh, an X-ray machine with a voice greeting?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Whoops. Put my foot in my mouth again. You should already be used to that though, right?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: But how quaint indeed. I didn't think anything could possibly change the way you dealt with people. Or should I say, your 'personality.'
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: There's always something.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Alright. Maybe I'd rather not pry into your personal affairs...
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: ...He's here. He's still here, and it's not just him. There's more. The scent of the sea. Since when were there so many Ægir in this little town?
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: The Inquisition planned it.
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: Maybe. Maybe even now, at this very moment, there are still Inquisitors, their heads addled with their ignorant laws, intent on continuing their self-righteous deeds.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: When did you have the time to wrap yourself up after escaping from the enemy?
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: ...An Ægir helped me.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: A friend?
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: No, just... an Ægir who loves the sea.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: What do we do about our brother's body?
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: It's currently in the hands of Amaia and Thiago. We'll have to figure something out.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: We ought to prepare a funeral for it.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: A funeral is a human ritual, not ours.
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: Amaia has said that we should live the way our hearts dictate. Pure in desire, pure in worship, just as those ignorant Inquisitors treat their own faith.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: Would that not make us equally ignorant?
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: Ignorance is a part of our very nature we have yet to throw away. We have not yet become them.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: Sophistry.
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: That, I can't deny. But do you wish to see the land-dwellers torment the corpse of our brother?
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: Long have we lived on land, with no Herald to guide us. All we can do is seek out our own way of embracing the ocean.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: But before that... we should give our brother a proper burial. We ought to mourn any senseless death.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: Who would be able to slay this creature with such ease? Thiago?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I'd understand if it had been surrounded by four or five Penal Battalion soldiers, or if it took the Flames of Castigation from an Inquisitor's lantern.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: But... this poor Sea Terror has but a single wound on its body.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: While I've never personally seen the rumored High Inquisitors fight, I'd imagine that if anyone in all of Iberia could pull this off, it'd be them.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Impossible! Nobody has seen an Inquisitor come to Gran Faro!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: But our little town, which rarely sees any outsiders, has been welcoming visitor after visitor as of late. Surely this can't all be due to the Inquisition's negligence, right?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: That...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Perhaps the marching of the Penal Battalion cannot be hidden from our ears, but what of the Inquisitors? If they changed out of their uniforms and concealed their lanterns and swords, how would we ever know?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: You mean to say that an Inquisitor might already be here? Hidden among the outsiders?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I'm saying it's a possibility.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: ...I'm going on a little walk.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Thiago!
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: I'm sure even you understand that most people would rather have the Inquisitors help them get rid of the Sea Terrors.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: I know. Of course I know. I wouldn't hate a beast for no reason. But I WILL hate those people. Those... Inquisitors.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Amaia gently caresses the Sea Terror's corpse. The fate left to it by death was not such a terrible one.
By human standards, it certainly appeared deformed and terrifying. But what about from other perspectives? How would the court of nature, of life itself, judge this perfect creature?
Alone in the empty pub, Amaia decides to stop pondering this question. Or at least, the pub appears empty. She and Thiago believe it is.
But the shadows begin to writhe, and something steps out from within, its simple outline etched out beneath the dim light's glow.
It is a person. An Ægir.
...Was this your doing?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: (Ægirian) It has nothing to do with you.
attributes.name: Bizarre Hunter

attributes.content: You don't look like you're from the Penal Battalion.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: (Ægirian) You cannot deceive me.
attributes.name: Bizarre Hunter

attributes.content: Wait, you're an Ægir? That makes you even less likely to be an Inquisitor.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: (Ægirian) Silence is the most terrifying sound in the sea. We cannot tolerate it a second time. None of us can.
attributes.name: Bizarre Hunter

attributes.content: I'm not sure what you're talking about, but I think you should leave—
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: (Ægirian) The Bishop of Sal Viento is dead.
attributes.name: Bizarre Hunter

attributes.content: (Ægirian) I am not as patient as you might believe.
attributes.name: Bizarre Hunter

attributes.content: (Ægirian) I never thought I'd see a living Abyssal Hunter with my own eyes.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Inquisitors? ...No, impossible. How could an Inquisitor be here?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Mr. Thiago! Just now, I—
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Mr. Thiago?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Get out of this place as soon as possible. You, and the rest of your lot.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: You're a nice lad, I can see that. Jordi can too. But...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: There's something sleeping beneath our little town, and there's nothing normal about any of this—No, Iberia's never been normal, not since then.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: ...I hear you. I'll leave as soon as I can.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: But I think I saw something in front of the chapel just now—
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Tell me, lad. Are you from the Inquisition? Are you trying to get close to Jordi so you can take him away?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Mr. Thiago?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Go ahead and lie to me. I'll fight you to the death too, outsider.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I'm not. You know as well as I do, if I were really after the Ægir, why would I wait so long?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: It's just a single Sea Terror. We're by the coast, and we've seen things like this before, decades ago.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: There's nothing to get worked up over, outsider. It's none of your business.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Mayor Thiago, I'm willing to help you iron out some of the issues in town.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: You? There's nothing for you to do.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Even if it means Jordi's life will be in danger?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Nobody's here? Why aren't Amaia and Thiago here...?
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: It's his scent!
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: That damn Ægir, he took Amaia away?! How dare he—
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: —No, that's not quite right. Amaia doesn't know how to fight. He wouldn't do anything to her.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: At least our brother's remains are still here.
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: What do we do now?
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: Take it away. This rotting shack is not suitable to be its coffin.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: After that... We will find it a proper home. Look at it—death is nothing more than a gentle attendant. That is something that Ægir butcher could never understand.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: Let's go.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: Hmm... So in other words, we're what? Insurance?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: To my understanding, none of you have any desire to return to the ocean and fight those monsters.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You were born of this sea, and are very powerful. But even if you regain your original forms, you will never be able to rid yourselves of those creatures.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Oh? It's that dangerous?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: More than you can imagine.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: To be honest though, we've never cared too much about that. We just do what we want. Most people inhabiting this great land probably think the same thing, right?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: If the Seaborn can understand language and music, then I'm sure you'll find an audience, even if disaster were to befall Terra.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: In fact, they're more complete creatures than humans, and have greater resistance to all sorts of things. Give them a few hundred years and maybe they'll even adapt to Originium.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: I'm aware.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Mm... So answer me this, Doctor.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Us, the Ægir, Sea Terrors, the Seaborn—and all our pitiable kin lurking in the depths of the ocean—
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: —How are any of us different in your eyes?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: You were born much later. There are many things you do not yet understand.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: When Frost awoke from a deep rock formation, her first thought was to get away from those aliens and monsters.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: There's nobody to communicate with in the sea, and everyone on land eventually hides their original forms and disappears. Fortunately, music can open a crack in the loneliness.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: If this situation is resolved, I'll have plenty of time to discuss the past.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I also hope that none of you actually... get involved with either Iberia's or the Ægir's plans.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Why not? I thought you were eager for us to lend a helping hand.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: It's been too long since I've been in touch with the Ægir. The tides are crying out, and a lack of information hampers my predictions.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We do not yet know the true origins of this calamity, nor are we able to infer any possibilities.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Worst-case scenario, even you won't have any way to— *sigh*... It seems we have uninvited guests.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: They already have the nerve to show themselves openly in town?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Someone's knocking at the door.
Without a word, Kal'tsit turns her eyes to the chapel's doors. The thick wooden slabs had endured an unfathomable amount of turmoil over the years, each mark upon them a chronicle of the past.
She knows there is something outside them, and what it is. What she cannot imagine, however, is that the Church of the Deep's followers would already dare to be so brazen.
Or perhaps...
Outsiders. A grotesque scent, belonging to those strange Ægir.
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: The two cultists step into the chapel. This Lateran edifice, once wrapped in the cloth of faith, now drapes these two faceless figures.
In their arms, they hold their 'brother,' a Sea Terror—or perhaps just a being stripped of all other names, now nothing more than an expired lifeform.
Look what they're holding in their arms...
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: A Sea Terror. They don't intend to fight.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The cultist carrying his brother's body passes by Kal'tsit without turning his head, as if he does not even see the two standing in his path.
It is as if he has come all the way from the doors of the chapel to step into the depths of martyrdom.
(Broken Ægirian) My brother, o brother. Hear me out.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: (Broken Ægirian) It is our incompetence that led to your untimely fate. It is our cowardice that prevented you from returning to the sea.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: (Broken Ægirian) Forgive me, my brother. I can yet hear your voice.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: (Broken Ægirian) The people of this world all believe death to be the terminus of all life, but we understand that once our individual forms are transcended, even death itself is powerless.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: He lays his brother's remains upon the ground and draws a deep breath. He falls to his knees, his eyes filled with sorrow.
(Broken Ægirian) Until we return to the ocean, I shall be your coffin. I will take you back to the deeps.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: (Broken Ægirian) Come, my brother. May you slumber eternally. We shall become one.
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: The oral ingestion of protein is an act of feeding, yet he did not intend to consume his brother.
He was simply forced to use a more primordial method of bringing the two together as one.
'Chimera.'
Urgh... Aaahh—
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: What is he doing?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: —Assimilation. The simplest method of forcefully penetrating his own torso with the Sea Terror's body.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Should we stop him? It's pretty gross, and totally lacking in aesthetics.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Someone will. But not us.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Juan! What are you doing!
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: Haah... I... It's still alive... I can feel it... What did you say?
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: The Inquisition is here!
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: You... Urgh... Graaah...
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: Repulsive.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Though this chapel may be deserted, it is still a sacred place to the Iberian Inquisition. And yet, you dare openly blaspheme our laws and creeds.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Someone from the Inquisition actually snuck in? But what happened to that Ægir?!
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: Juan!
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: You...! Curse you... Hrrgh... Damn Iberian!
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: Kill him!
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: Graaah!
attributes.name: Strange Adherent

attributes.content: The Sea Terror of the grim lake crests and troughs as the mountains roiling in the twilight. Carrying the scent of rotting flesh, the traitor nearly usurps the throne of his new home, screeching gleefully.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: To think that you'd target such a small, inconspicuous town after Sal Viento. Even now, the Inquisition underestimates the scope of the Church of the Deep's influence. Indeed, your taint is pervasive.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Juan! The Inquisitor! You have to—!
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: You're even weaker than any Church of the Deep remnants I've seen. Why do you insist on staying in this unremarkable town?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Answer me.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen
